src:
Sempat Hilang di Hutan, Wanita Ini Ditemukan Berkat Tulisan S.O.S
01 Nov 2019, 09:46 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Foto: Gomez dan Tim berhasil ditemukan dan mendarat dengan selamat (Little Baldy SAR 19-153)

Sequoia - Wanita berusia 56 tahun berhasil diselamatkan setelah hilang di Taman Nasional California. Dia meminta bantuan dengan memberi tanda S.O.S menggunakan batu.dilansir Travel+Leisure, wanita yang sempat hilang ini bernama Mary Joanna Gomez. Dia adalah perawat dalam perjalanan dari Mississippi yang ditemukan hidup dengan kondisi yang stabil di Taman Nasional Sequoia oleh penjaga taman.Sebelum menghilang, terakhir kali Gomez menghubungi anak perempuannya. Dia memberikan pesan dan juga mengirimkan foto yang diambil di Kings Canyon. Gomez mengatakan kepada keluarganya, dia berniat ingin mengunjungi Sequoia.


Foto: Mary Joanna Gomez (kiri) (Little Baldy SAR 19-153)

Gomez dilaporkan hilang ke Kantor Polisi San Francisco pada hari Jumat karena tidak muncul untuk bekerja. Setelah menghilang, S.O.S. yang dibuat dari batu oleh Gomez ditemukan oleh Pesawat Kalifornia C-130.S.O.S sendiri merupakan kode morse internasional yang artinya meminta bantuan saat hilang. Artinya bisa beragam seperti Save Our Souls, hingga Stop Other Signals.Petugas darat yang mencari Gomez merespon telah menemukan mobilnya pada Sabtu Malam. Tepatnya beberapa waktu menjelang tengah malam di jalan raya dekat jalan setapak.Pada Senin pagi, Gomez ditemukan di luar jalur sekitar 3,5 mil atau sekitar 4,8 km dari mobilnya di medan berbatu yang curam. Gomez mengaku merasa kedinginan, haus dan lapar. Tetapi dia dalam kondisi kesehatan yang baik. Simak Video "Tingkatkan Keselamatan Penumpang, Grab Luncurkan SOS Button"[Gambas:Video 20detik](elk/elk)
text:
Had Lost in the Forest, This Woman Found Thanks to the writings of S.O.S
Nov 1, 2019, 09:46 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Photo: Gomez and Team successfully found and landed safely (Little Baldy SAR 19-153)

Sequoia - 56-year-old woman was rescued after being lost in California National Park. He asked for help by giving an S.O.S sign using the stone. The Travel + Leisure reporter, the woman who was lost was named Mary Joanna Gomez. She was a nurse on her way from Mississippi who was found to be living in stable conditions in Sequoia National Park by park rangers. Before disappearing, the last time Gomez contacted her daughter. He gave a message and also sent photos taken at Kings Canyon. Gomez told his family he intended to visit Sequoia.


Photo: Mary Joanna Gomez (left) (Little Baldy SAR 19-153)

Gomez was reported missing to the San Francisco Police Station on Friday because he did not show up for work. After disappearing, S.O.S. which was made of stone by Gomez was discovered by California C-130.S.O.S Aircraft itself is an international morse code which means to ask for help when lost. This means that it can be as varied as Save Our Souls, to Stop Other Signals. Land officers who are looking for Gomez have responded to finding his car on Saturday Night. Precisely some time before midnight on the highway near the trail. On Monday morning, Gomez was found off the track about 3.5 miles or about 4.8 km from his car on a steep rocky terrain. Gomez claimed to feel cold, thirsty and hungry. But he is in good health. Watch Video "Improving Passenger Safety, Grab Launches SOS Button" [Gambas: Video 20sec] (elk / elk)
